Proto Parameters

Handle creation of the proto-objects its visualizations.

Sample the patch or proto-object map M(t), the proto parameters and calculate the center of mass of the proto-objects. Additionally, creates the visual representation of the proto-objects.

Authors:

  • Giuseppe Boccignone <giuseppe.boccignone@unimi.it>

  • Renato Nobre <renato.avellarnobre@studenti.unimi.it>

Changes:

  • 12/12/2012 First Edition Matlab

  • 31/05/2022 Python Edition

class proto_parameters.ProtoParameters[source]

Handle creation of the proto-objects its visualizations.

Note

The proto-parameters, its visual representation, centers, and areas are stored in the object, and are updated at each frame.

sample_proto_objects(salience_map)[source]

Sample the proto-objects and create visualizations.

Sample the patch or proto-object map M(t), the proto parameters and calculate the center of mass of the proto-objects. Additionally, creates the visual representation of the proto-objects.

Using the proto-object representation which is the base of method described in 1.

Note

The proto-parameters and its visual representation are stored in the object, and are updated at each frame.

Parameters

saliency_map (np.ndarray) – Frame saliency map

Returns

num_proto (int) – Number of proto-objects found.

References

1

Halir, R., & Flusser, J. (1998, February). Numerically stable direct least squares fitting of ellipses. In Proc. 6th International Conference in Central Europe on Computer Graphics and Visualization. WSCG (Vol. 98, pp. 125-132). Citeseer.

_calculate_center_area(num_proto)[source]

Calculate center and Area of proto-objects.

Determine the center and the area of patches for subsequent IP sampling.

Note

The proto-parameters area and centers are stored in the object, and are updated at each frame.

Parameters

num_proto (int) – Number of proto-objects found.

_sample_proto_params(mt_map)[source]

Update the class patch map M(t) parameters \(theta_p\).

In a first step finds the boundaries of the actual patches.

Note

The proto-parameters and are stored in the object, and are updated at each frame.

Parameters

mt_map (np.ndarray) – the patch map \(M(t)\)

Returns

num_proto (int) – Number of protoparametes

_sample_proto_map(s_map)[source]

Generates the patch map M(t).

In a first step generates the raw patch map by thresholding the normalized salience map so as to achieve 95% significance level for deciding whether the given saliency values are in the extreme tails. For further information, see also 2.

Parameters

  • s_map (matrix) – the salience map, 0/1 overlay representation

  • curr_frame (matrix) – the current frame

  • n_best_proto (integer) – the N_V most valuable patches

Returns

  • mt_map (matrix) – the patch map M(t)

  • proto_map (matrix) – the object layer representation of patch map M(t)

  • norm_sal (matrix) – the normalized salience map

References

2

Boccignone, G., & Ferraro, M. (2013). Ecological sampling of gaze shifts. IEEE transactions on cybernetics, 44(2), 266-279.

_sample_best_patches(proto_map_raw)[source]

Samples the N_V best patches.

Samples the N_V best patches ranked through their size and returns the actual M(t) map.

Parameters

proto_map_raw (matrix) – the raw patch map

Returns

mt_map (matrix) – the patch map M(t)
